metadata.synopsis: One of a pair of Zhentarim agents trapped in a cave by gnolls. A veteran mercenary, tough, and above all else a survivor. The rest of their crew are dead. Rugan here is the senior agent of the two, and he's grimly determined to survive this terrible situation.

4.speaker: Rugan
4.text: That drink I promised will have to wait. We're moving out. The Elfsong's my local - look me up if you're in the city.
4.context: NodeContext: Through his teeth, but friendly.

7.speaker: Rugan
7.text: Thank the gods that's over. Wish you'd been with us when the beasts attacked on the road.

36.speaker: Rugan
36.text: I'll take the cargo back to Zarys at the hideout. Drop by and see me when you can - I owe you a drink.

182.speaker: Rugan
182.text: Might have been more survivors... I don't suppose you saw any of my crew alive out there?
182.context: NodeContext: relief but a note of concern

8.speaker: Rugan
8.text: Thanks. You always seem to show up at just the right time.
8.context: InternalNodeContext: Rugan's thanking the player after being freed.NodeContext: Through his teeth, but friendly.

65.speaker: Rugan
65.text: Thanks again. We'll head out as soon as we've caught our breath.

178.speaker: Rugan
178.text: By the gods, you're a sweet sight.

120.speaker: Rugan
120.text: Are any of my crew still alive out there?

169.speaker: Rugan
169.text: This whole journey's been one grim sight after another. Gnolls, goblins... drow.
169.context: NodeContext: sadly, with disgust and fear on the last word

1.speaker: Rugan
1.text: Risen Road's more dangerous than ever. You're the first friendly face we've seen since Elturgard.

0.speaker: Player
0.text: Elturgard's a long way from here. Where are you heading?

44.speaker: Rugan
44.text: We're bound for Baldur's Gate - got some cargo to deliver. But we've a stop to make along the way.

25.speaker: Rugan
25.text: Waukeen's Rest. It's just up the road. I'd be enjoying a mug of ale right now if those beasts hadn't jumped us.
25.context: NodeContext: Wau-KEEN's Rest is a tavern. Regretful

153.speaker: Rugan
153.text: Listen. You look like you know how to handle yourself.
153.context: NodeContext: Pause before speaking as he looks us up and down, appraising us

46.speaker: Rugan
46.text: You should meet my associates. We've got our own drinking spot by the tavern - invitation only.
46.context: NodeContext: With a smile on 'invitation only'

79.speaker: Rugan
79.text: Tell the fellow on the door 'little serpent, long shadow'. He'll take good care of you.
79.context: NodeContext: inviting us into his secret club

161.speaker: Olly
161.context: NodeContext: Spoken to 'Rugan' - interrupting and expressing serious concern. But hissed through his teeth rather than shouted

59.speaker: Rugan
59.text: It's fine. We'd be dead if they hadn't showed up. A little hospitality won't do any harm.
59.context: NodeContext: Reassuring his friend who just interrupted him -'they' is the player(s).

156.speaker: Player
156.text: Waukeen's Rest has been burned to the ground.

13.speaker: Rugan
13.context: NodeContext: With a sad shake of the head - just got some bad news

131.speaker: Rugan
131.text: Doesn't change the plan though - we'll head over there, and check for survivors.

19.speaker: Player
19.text: What's in the chest? Your cargo?

139.speaker: Rugan
139.text: Aye. The whole reason we're in this mess. Trinkets for some rich tosser in Baldur's Gate.

90.speaker: Rugan
90.text: He gets his shiny baubles, we get a handful of Tarenths.
90.context: NodeContext: disdainful.  With a shrug - follows on from a line "he gets a shiny new bauble for his dressing room...". It's a complaint about doing dangerous work for little reward. Tarenths are a currency - first syllable as in 'ta-da', second rhymes with 'tenth'.

136.speaker: Narrator
136.text: *Tarenths are the currency of a merchant network called the Zhentarim. Led by the mysterious Pereghost of Darkhold, their dealings are far from scrupulous.*
136.context: NodeContext: Player internal monologue, after recognising the word 'tarenths'. Tarenths are a currency - first syllable as in 'ta-da', second rhymes with 'tenth'.

157.speaker: Player
157.text: You're Zhentarim. Your people don't deal in 'baubles'.

56.speaker: Player
56.text: A lot of people died for those baubles.

93.speaker: Rugan
93.text: Rich men place more value on wine and fine clothes than on the lives of folks like me.

138.speaker: Rugan
138.text: It's a pretty bit of frippery that'll sit on a mantel gathering dust. But the pay for delivering it makes the risk worthwhile.

154.speaker: Player
154.text: You're Zhent - I'd wager more than just your crew have died over these 'baubles'.

91.speaker: Player
91.text: Whatever your cargo is, I'll take it as payment.

113.speaker: Rugan
113.text: Listen - I'm indebted to you. And that's why I'm giving you a chance to walk away before you get yourself killed.
113.context: NodeContext: intimidated, but trying to defuse a potentially violent situation

83.speaker: Rugan
83.text: You made short work of the gnolls... reckon you'd make shorter work of me and the boy.
83.context: NodeContext: intimidated, but trying to defuse a potentially violent situation

18.speaker: Rugan
18.text: But we're not merchants; we're Zhentarim agents. Steal from us, and you'll have a price on your head.
18.context: NodeContext: intimidated, but trying to turn the tables by revealing he's a zhentarim - a network of dangerous merchants and mercenaries

198.speaker: Player
198.text: Zhentarim agents guarding a single chest. Curious.

88.speaker: Rugan
88.text: If there are valuable goods on the move, The Black Company's always involved.
88.context: NodeContext: with a smile, trying to impress us

5.speaker: Rugan
5.text: We're the grease that keeps the wheels of commerce turning.
5.context: NodeContext: describing the faction he works for proudly

67.speaker: Rugan
67.text: And we don't take kindly to people who meddle in our business.
67.context: NodeContext: a threat - but delivered as a friendly warning

74.speaker: Player
74.text: If your bosses come after the chest, I'll kill them as well.

188.speaker: Rugan
188.text: Tougher bastards than you have tried. Let's just go our separate ways, and be thankful we're all in one piece.

85.speaker: Rugan
85.text: If I lose that cargo, my people will do worse to me than the gnolls would've.
85.context: NodeContext: intimidated but trying to defuse the situation

54.speaker: Player
54.text: The Zhentarim aren't known for mercy, true.

146.speaker: Rugan
146.text: You know who we are - very clever. Then you probably also know it's not smart to interfere with Zhent business.
146.context: NodeContext: appraising us - with a friendly warning

63.speaker: Rugan
63.text: This is the point when a clever operator like you accepts my gratitude and walks away.

42.speaker: Player
42.text: Enough talking. I'll have that cargo, or I'll have your head.

168.speaker: Player
168.text: No. This is the point where I stop asking, and start cutting.

144.speaker: Rugan
144.text: Fine - no need for more violence. I'll tell my associates everything was lost in the ambush.
144.context: NodeContext: backing down from a violent situation - intimidated

117.speaker: Rugan
117.text: And no hard feelings, y'hear? I'd have done the same if I were you. Business at the end of a blade is still business.

167.speaker: Rugan
167.text: Ruthless bastard like you could make a name for yourself in the Zhentarim. Make sure to drop by our hideout.

164.speaker: Rugan
164.text: My associates will do worse to me than you ever could.
164.context: NodeContext: intimidated but more scared of his associates than of us

177.speaker: Player
177.text: This is your employer's mess - but we can profit. Let's sell the cargo ourselves.

101.speaker: Player
101.text: You're missing a golden opportunity. Report the cargo lost - and we can sell it ourselves.

10.speaker: Player
10.text: You serve your oath to the Zhent impressively, but I'm afraid I'll be taking that cargo. Now.

127.speaker: Player
127.text: You'll find I'm very persuasive. We can make much more coin than you would with your employers.

37.speaker: Rugan
37.text: I like the way you think. Didn't expect to turn this horrorshow to my advantage... but why not?

203.speaker: Rugan
203.text: The chest's all yours. Damn thing's sealed tighter than a Duke's pursestrings, so there's no point in trying to open it.

61.speaker: Rugan
61.text: I know a fence in Baldur's Gate who'll take it off your hands. Nobody will be the wiser.

193.speaker: Rugan
193.text: Don't try to cut me out of the deal though. The Black Network has eyes and blades everywhere.

208.speaker: Rugan
208.text: Crafty swine like you could make a name for yourself in the Zhentarim. Make sure to drop by our hideout.

143.speaker: Rugan
143.text: Crafty swine like you could make a name for yourself in the Zhentarim. Make sure to drop by our hideout.

47.speaker: Rugan
47.text: Pass phrase at the door is 'little serpent, long shadow'. I'll tell my associates to expect you.
47.context: NodeContext: with a smile, inviting us to his secret 'club'

3.speaker: Player
3.text: I already met your friends - we didn't get along too well.

28.speaker: Rugan
28.text: And yet here you are. There's not many cause trouble in a Zhent hideout and walk away.

207.speaker: Rugan
207.text: I'd rather walk away too. So let's say our goodbyes, and speak no more of it.

174.speaker: Player
174.text: Fair. But I expect to be paid for saving your life.

192.speaker: Rugan
192.text: Of course. I was just about to suggest the same thing.

17.speaker: Rugan
17.text: I'd have given you my coin already if I had any. I've nothing for you, friend.

64.speaker: Rugan
64.text: I don't think so - you sound rattled. Those gnolls put up quite a fight, I bet.
64.context: NodeContext: assessing the situation, thinks he might have the upper hand on us

72.speaker: Player
72.text: You can leave - but your cargo stays.

204.speaker: Rugan
204.text: Take it. Just let me go - you don't need any more blood on your hands.

123.speaker: Rugan
123.text: You talk big - but I don't believe you took on the whole hideout. This belongs to the Zhent!
123.context: NodeContext: 'This' is his cargo, a nearby chest. Assessing us and thinking he can take us on

159.speaker: Rugan
159.text: Coin ain't any use to the dead. And dead's what I'll be if I welch on this deal.
159.context: NodeContext: intimidated but trying to talk himself out of a violent situation

196.speaker: Rugan
196.text: Let's go our separate ways, and be thankful we're all in one piece.
196.context: NodeContext: trying to calm a potentially violent situation

162.speaker: Player
162.text: You had your chance. Either way, that cargo's mine.

49.speaker: Rugan
49.text: Bloody fool. May the Black Hand take you.

126.speaker: Player
126.text: The cargo. Give it to me. Or else.

121.speaker: Player
121.text: Darkhold was getting concerned. I've been sent to retrieve the shipment.
121.context: InternalNodeContext: needs to set a zhentarim pereghost deception flag stage 1 global flag

45.speaker: Rugan
45.text: Zarys won't be happy. But, I suppose she can take it up with the Pereghost herself. Take the chest.

140.speaker: Rugan
140.text: If you haven't stopped by our Waukeen's Rest spot, you should. I'm sure Zarys'd welcome such a... prestigious guest.

133.speaker: Rugan
133.text: Invoking the Pereghost is a bold lie indeed. A smart lie, too.

206.speaker: Narrator
206.text: *Tarenths are the currency of the Zhentarim - a network of merchants and mercenaries with few scruples.*
206.context: NodeContext: Player internal monologue, after recognising the word 'tarenths'. Tarenths are a currency - first syllable as in 'ta-da', second rhymes with 'tenth'.

158.speaker: Player
158.text: It's not hospitality I want - it's coin.

200.speaker: Rugan
200.text: Shame we lost so many agents. But the chest is all that matters - Zarys'd have our hides if we lost it.
200.context: NodeContext: interior monologue as we read his thoughts - reflective and pragmatic

86.speaker: Player
86.text: Not looking for new friends. Looking for coin. Now.

190.speaker: Player
190.text: Zarys sent me to secure the cargo.

52.speaker: Player
52.text: Zarys sent me to secure the cargo.

66.speaker: Player
66.text: Maybe I should come - see you don't get waylaid again.

122.speaker: Rugan
122.text: Thanks. But that won't be necessary. We'll find help at Waukeen's Rest.
122.context: NodeContext: Turning down an offer of an escort from players. Wau-KEEN's rest is a nearby inn

141.speaker: Rugan
141.text: Trinkets for some rich tosser in Baldur's Gate.

186.speaker: Player
186.text: I'll stay friendly - so long as you hand over all your goods.

12.speaker: Rugan
12.text: Hold on now. You made short work of the beasts, and I reckon you'd make shorter of me and the boy.
12.context: NodeContext: intimidated, trying to defuse a hostile situation

135.speaker: Rugan
135.text: But we're not plump little merchants you can boss around.
135.context: NodeContext: with a note of warning

100.speaker: Rugan
100.context: CinematicNodeContext: He shows us a Zhent symbol - held in his hand - a medallion maybe?NodeContext: expecting us to be intimidated/impressed - the Zhentarim are a dangeorus faction of gangster-like mercenaries and merchants

181.speaker: Player
181.text: All I saw was blood and guts.

187.speaker: Rugan
187.text: Damn it. I guess that's a no.
187.context: NodeContext: with a sad shake of the head - accepting that all his companions are probably dead

26.speaker: Player
26.text: All dead. Zarys sent me to secure the cargo.

77.speaker: Rugan
77.text: We'll take the chest back to the hideout. I owe you a drink. Lots of drinks.

38.speaker: Rugan
38.text: Since when does a mule know what it carries?
38.context: NodeContext: comparing himself to 'a mule' with a wry smile

34.speaker: Player
34.text: This isn't a rescue, it's a robbery. I want the chest.

199.speaker: Rugan
199.text: You bloody idiot. If Zarys doesn't get that chest, she'll have us all killed.
199.context: NodeContext: intimidated but trying to talk himself out of a threatening situation

170.speaker: Rugan
170.text: You saved my life. I'm grateful for that - Zarys will be too - but I need to deliver the cargo. This is the point when you walk away.
170.context: NodeContext: intimidated but trying to talk himself out of a threatening situation

173.speaker: Rugan
173.text: Bloody fool. You don't scare me!
173.context: NodeContext: intimidated despite the bravado- preparing to defend himself

155.speaker: Player
155.text: The chest is mine now. Only question is if you live or not.

149.speaker: Player
149.text: You owe me more than a drink. How about some coin?

73.speaker: Player
73.text: I'll buy my own drinks. Money. Now.

137.speaker: Rugan
137.text: Black Hand be thanked. I didn't think anyone would find us.

179.speaker: Rugan
179.text: Risen Road's more dangerous than ever. Packs of gnolls running wild. Be careful out there.
179.context: NodeContext: Through his teeth, but friendly.

185.speaker: Rugan
185.text: The chest's yours. I've got nothing else for you, and I don't want trouble.

202.speaker: Rugan
202.text: Remember - getting that chest to Baldur's Gate is your job. Then we share the profits.

209.speaker: Rugan
209.text: Thanks again. Hope Zarys treated you to something nice.
209.context: NodeContext: Through his teeth, but friendly.
